page.title: 13Trees-Private woodlands
page.content: Deciduous trees are a rare feature of the Caithness landscape.Surprisingly two such plantings lie within our block as there are only seven clumps of deciduous trees from Wick to the Ord.These private woodlands are found at Hempriggs house (approx 150) and Thrumster house (approx 300trees). The trees which form avenues along the driveways and around the mansions were no doubt planted to give privacy as well as shelter from the biting winds that sweep the countryside even in summer.The commonest species are Elm, Sycamore,Ash,Beech, Willow,Birch and Rowan.Many are lichen-covered and not fully in leaf till late May.These old trees form ideal roosts for birds and a habitat for woodland flora and fauna There is a fifteen year old planting of evergreens at Thrumster house (approx 400 trees).
